metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2924 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Security: Encryption). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.45 and prior and 5.7.27 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 5.3 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.18-0ubuntu3').
